definition.sentence: It is only possible for research on understanding natural language to make progress when the researchers realize that the heart of NLU is the understanding process , not language per se .
definition.definiens: the understanding process , not language per se

definition.sentence: Prolog lends itsself in a natural way as an implementation language for DRT .

definition.sentence: But from those whose 'meaning ' is better understood -namely , declarative , yes-frO `` question , surprise~redundancy , rise-fall-rise , and continuation rise contours -it seems ( Hirschberg & Pierrehumbert 1986 ) that tunes convey two sorts of inforation : first , propositional attitudes the speaker wishes to associate with an utterance and , second , speaker commitment to some structural relationship holding between utterances .
definition.definiens: attitudes the speaker wishes to associate with an utterance and , second , speaker commitment to some structural relationship holding between utterances

definition.sentence: There is no such constraint associated with the indefinite determiner , which leaves the hearer free to hypothesize new individuating sets in the absence of any other prohibitive constraints .

definition.sentence: Grammatical analysis is the derivation of a description for an object according to the rules of a grammar that axiomatizes the description relation .

definition.sentence: 60 Learning is one of the most exciting aspects of connectionist models for both the AI and psychology communities .
definition.definiens: one of the most exciting aspects of connectionist models for both the AI and psychology communities

definition.sentence: Central to the mapping process is the principle of systematicity : people prefer to map systems of predicates that contain higher-order relations with inferential import , rather than to map isolated predicates .
SME propagates entity-correspondences upward and finds the largest possible systems of matched predicates with consistent object-mappings .
definition.definiens: propagates entity-correspondences upward and finds the largest possible systems of matched predicates with consistent object-mappings

definition.sentence: Concepts ( and attributes and categories ) manifest themselves as patterns of activation distributed throughout a strongly connected network of nodes , where the nodes ~by themselves signify nothing in particular .
definition.definiens: patterns of activation distributed throughout a strongly connected network of nodes , where the nodes ~by themselves signify nothing in particular

definition.sentence: One of the reasons why connectionists ( at least the PDP variety ) are preoccupied with learning is because they see no other systematic way to approach the design of large ( at least 100,000 nodes ) networks which can not be understood as static data structures .
definition.definiens: least 100,000 nodes ) networks which can not be understood as static data structures

definition.sentence: Let us consider a definition of an N~ : A mental model is a cognitive construct that describes a person 's understanding of a particular content domain in the world .
definition.definiens: a cognitive construct that describes a person 's understanding of a particular content domain in the world

definition.sentence: Each conceptual graph consists of nodes which either represent concepts or conceptual relations .
definition.definiens: consists of nodes which either represent concepts or conceptual relations

definition.sentence: For example , if the representational system is CGs , then the translation maps words into concepts .
definition.definiens: the translation maps words into concepts

definition.sentence: Using this-word-to concept mapping , the conceptual processor constructs a conceptual structure ( graph ) which represents the meaning of the linguistic input .
definition.definiens: represents the meaning of the linguistic input
